concise_definition: n. 锦标赛, 冠军头衔, 冠军赛事

definitions.explanation_en: A competition or series of contests to determine the best player, team, or entity in a particular sport or activity, often held annually or periodically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为确定某一运动或活动中最优秀选手、团队或实体而举办的竞赛或系列赛事，通常每年或定期举行。
definitions.example_en: She has won three national championships in swimming.
definitions.example_cn: 她曾三次赢得全国游泳锦标赛冠军。

definitions.explanation_en: The title or status of being the champion in a particular sport or field, often awarded after winning a final competition.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在某项运动或领域中赢得冠军后所获得的头衔或地位，通常在决赛获胜后授予。
definitions.example_en: The team celebrated their hard-earned championship after the final match.
definitions.example_cn: 球队在决赛获胜后庆祝了来之不易的冠军头衔。

definitions.explanation_en: A championship event or tournament that serves as the ultimate contest to decide the top competitor in a league or organization.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在某个联赛或组织中作为决定顶尖竞争者的最终赛事的锦标赛。
definitions.example_en: The World Cup is the most prestigious championship in international football.
definitions.example_cn: 世界杯是国际足球领域最负盛名的锦标赛。

comparison.analysis: “Tournament”（锦标赛）泛指由多轮比赛组成的竞赛体系，不一定以决出唯一冠军为目标，也可能用于排名或选拔。而 “championship” 强调最终的冠军归属，是锦标赛的最高目标或结果。所有 championship 都是 tournament，但并非所有 tournament 都是 championship。
“Title”（头衔）是抽象的荣誉或身份，如“世界冠军头衔”，而 “championship” 既可以指头衔本身，也可以指赢得该头衔的赛事。因此，“title” 更侧重结果，而 “championship” 可同时指过程和结果。
“Competition”（竞赛）是广义词，泛指任何形式的比拼，包括非正式或小规模的对抗。而 “championship” 是一种特定类型的、通常具有官方性、权威性和高规格的竞赛，专为决定冠军而设，层级更高、更正式。
